sect1.para: The tutorial consists of a simple model, some test data for this model and a Java program to query the data. It includes the InterMine jar, its dependencies, the necessary configuration files and a build script. A prerequisite for the tutorial is a Java compiler and interpreter.
Running the tutorial involves a few simple steps:

orderedlist.listitem: Download and unpack the latest InterMine tutorial (intermine-tutorial-xxxxxx)
Install the Ant build tool. Note that the ant executable must be on your PATH

Install the PostgreSQL database and create a database named "tutorial". Note that the postmaster must be set up to accept TCP/IP connections ("tcpip_socket=true" in postgresql.conf) from "localhost" (host 127.0.0.1 in pg_ident.conf). Consult the PostgreSQL documentation for more details on configuring access control and database creation
Change to the tutorial root directory
Modify the "intermine.properties" configuration file to reflect your database username, and password if necessary

Run the ant command to view the available build targets. ant run will compile the InterMine system, build a simple model, store some data corresponding to the model (accessing the database), and run some queries to retrieve the data. The tutorial source (src/java/org/intermine/tutorial/SimpleQuery.java) demonstrates how to build a simple query for a model (model/tutorial_model.xml) and navigate the results, which can be compared to the test data (resources/tutorial_data.xml)
